Posts.Content: Hi Hides I am on Tamoxifen since last August, I was taking my tablet in the morning and by lunchtime I was feeling the pain I wasn't sure if it was the Tamoxifen or my rheumatoid arthritis so I started taking the tablet at 2pm and it helped improve the aches and delayed it til the evening at least I was at home by then. I was given naproxen but had a allergic reaction with itching all over like nettle rash, now I am pain killer free. I always get the same brand Relonchem Tamoxifen as I read that different brands effect everyone differently it's to do with the various bulking agents they use in the tablets so it might be worth asking your chemist for a different brand as it might be better suited to you. Relonchem was the first brand I had and now I'm settled with its side effects so I won't change from them I must admit every day I have to take those horrible tablets I have tell myself its preventing the beast and refrain myself from throwing them in the bin. Only 4.5 years to go lets hope I have the staying power  make sure you keep drinking enough water on the Rads it does make a difference and of course moisturize bucket loads Good luck to you on your journey  Debs xx
Posts.Title: Aching joints

Posts.Content: Hi WhatHappened of course you can use the picture however you like it's yours, I was just impressed how it came out so well as I took it with my phone Don't knock your 20 mins walking its still more than some do and you've made a start so well done, I hated walking at the start but it gets easier I was told it takes 21 times doing it til you start to enjoy it, now I do my work and think now it's my time and can't wait to get out and feel the freedom, I found that walking has improved my memory which helps as I've only left the hot tap running once and emptied the whole system so hopefully never again.   I giggle to myself when I say I started walking its like I'm a baby whose just started to walk but I'm 51!!! Have a lovely day xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone,  what a bright glorious and cold day we’ve had today Of course WhatHappened I had every faith that you would go for a walk Leolady56,  I thought go girl with the hot cross buns. I must confess my reward for the 3.12 km walk today was hot cross buns. Yum yum   Hi Yellowroses, we are so lucky to have the scenery we do Mudeford Quay, Tuckton and of course Christchurch,we are truly blessed Hi Aspen, you’re getting through the chemo, well done everyone done is another step closer to the end of treatment, my ear is here if you need it xx Well my walk today: it was cold and I was ready for it hat, gloves and scarf,  the wind was biting I started to walk then I nearly turned back round my cheeks were so cold (face cheeks not bottom cheeks!!!) then I thought I must get to the clifftop to get some pics, so I quickened my pace and before I knew it my cheeks were warmer and I was there, took some pics the gorse is out and it looks so pretty and I even saw a big ole bumblebee. I made my way back via the shop for my reward somef hot cross buns
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi to all the walkers Bigguy & Shimmeringunicorn, I too have avoided the shell suit as I was afraid if I got near to anything hot it would end up being like the old crisp packets when you used to grill them to make them shrink!! those were the days Cannon nice pics of Glastonbury abbey  Busy day today Hospital for Ecg ultrasound hopefully last one for 6 months then work but I made it out this afternoon for a walk. I done 3.4km walked one extra road so gently increasing the mileage, A nice sunny walk but the air was cold These feet were made for walking      Spring is on it's way  Keep it up we can do this together :)  xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi ShimmeringUnicorn I see they've bought a cake out in honour of your birthday yesterday I failed in the odd sock day, I was too embarrassed to wear odd socks to the podiatrist but at least I found why the pain in left foot it was high instep and movement on metatarsals causing wear, inflammation and burr on tarsal so I'm getting orthotics made so my walking can get back to enjoyable walks, still got the stinky cold but went to work but felt washed out so I didn't go for a walk after work, I settled for coffee and ginger nut biscuits they helped me feel better as feeling a total failure today in the sock/walking department :) Debs xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Jacmatholmad  been on Tamoxifen since August and the Hot flashes are the worst to deal with I currently take sage tablets which help through the day but they play havoc in the evenings I totally agree with Leolady56 about either cold or boiling hot there is no just feeling normal temperature at the moment I have the chills it's a real pain in the posterior, hopefully time will get rid of them, I'm not sure if the degenerative disc is more to do with the tamoxifen or my arthritis but RA doctor said it wasn't to do with arthritis, but I don't let it get me down, still get out for work and walking I read about your face plant and I thought a girl of my own heart a professional faller, I always seem to go down on my knees except when I slipped down my stairs and took my elbow out. the act of falling really jolts the whole body and can make you stiff and sore all over I sympathise with you  Leolady56  Here's pics of our walk today, took photos of our shoes and my partner asked if I was putting them on a foot fetish site :) It was cold and breezy but worth the effort 3.15 km done  Violetsniff Good job done by Scotland made it back in time for 2nd half  Debs xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi mrsox  I think the last time I was a size 8 I was 10 years old as I love food, I love strawberries and plums when they are in season, carrot cake is my absolute favorite.  Here's my pics of todays baking, Paul Hollywoods carrot cake recipe its yummy and a quiche both for sister birthday family get together tomorrow, I also made victoria sponge but that needs building with cream and fresh raspberries tomorrow I got out this afternoon for a 3.39km walk along the clifftop, there was a few para chute guys i waited to get a photo but they didn't manage to jump of the cliff as it wasn't windy enough, so I've attached picture of flower I took yesterday in the rain in my garden :) I love yorkies, I had 2 yorkies growing up, my first was a rescue dog who lived in a old car she was so dirty when we got her she had to be bathed twice, her name was Sindy, we let her mate and kept a pup and she was pippa they are fantastic dogs. and I do miss them. Roland sounds fun bet he won't like going without hes sausages and goodies Debs xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi  Leolady56   oh what a dilemma you have, my advice is not to wear 2 left socks or you will be going round in circles all day my dilemma is if I join your odd sock day I will be embarrassed as I have a biomechanical pediatry appointment in the morning. I would class myself a little ocd as I managed to pack odd socks for my weekend away and it felt wrong and I couldn't wait to get home to get them changed, would it be permissable to wear a matching pair to podiatry then change afterwards :) I am starting to feel more human again and hopefully be good enough for a little walk tomorrow Debs xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone My stinky cold has gone and my energy is back, the sun is shining and the snow has gone so I got myself up and out this morning to walk 3.km along the clifftop, I have missed my walking for the last 2 weeks so today was a restart and I really enjoyed it the air was fresh a perfect spring morning Has anyone taken Citalopram and suffered nausea, I thought it was to do with my cold but cold has gone and nausea has remained, I delayed taking tablet in morning and bam the hot flushes returned so I'd rather feel sick than feel like I'm suffocating, has anyone got advice on dealing with the nausea I hope everyone up north who still have the snow, stay safe and warm  Debs xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone WhatHappened  thank you for the mention and concern, big hug to you xx I'm doing ok feeling a bit bashed up by stinking cold which I caught one last month and thought I was over it in 2 weeks then started walking and normal life stuff then last week caught another stinky cold but because the chemo last year attacked my esophagus and gave me esophagistis really bad its left me with a weakness there and the stinky cold made me sick and bad with acid it's really weird how a cold can affect you and it has triggered the fatigue I suppose its the new normal and I'm not invincible I had a follow up oncology last week and thought I would find out whether I was Peri. Meno or Post or was it whether I'm spring chicken, old bird or a boiler :) but they only did one blood test for it which points to post meno but not conclusive so in 2 months a blood test for 3 weeks on the trot then they can find out, but what they did tested for which they didn't say was tumour biomarkers and it was negative so I was very chuffed but a bit surprised as I thought it wasn't tested for and it would just be the mammogram, the decision was to stay on Tamoxifen as I'm arthritic its best to leave me alone whilst I'm pain free and not to rock my boat with change of pills I've done plenty of sitting in armchair and sadly no walking, but I ventured out to take picture of daffodil a little ray of sunshine I do love the spring xxx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Leolady56  You made me chuckle, my oestrogen is in the confused.com section, but my cold could do with broiler broth :) I am sorry you are having to face the chemo/rads scenario but I hope you find strength in chocolate and wine also with Easter on the horizon plenty of chocolates about                 Debs xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi moomy  I can really sympathise as I used to get hives they are such a pain have you tried refrigerated Aloe vera on them, hopefully your stress sudsides and blue sunny skies are around the corner I love daffodils that are outside I wish they lasted all year, last week whilst I was out, theres a woodland walk across the road from where I live and a woman was picking the wild daffs, yes I did shout at her to stop I was incensed that they are there for everyones enjoyment and not for selfish people to help themselves Debs xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Penny lane  Its Bournemouth, you can see the polar bear on the Isle of Wight, It's when your home is like being on holiday all year, Nefyn looks beautiful we are so lucky in this country to have such beautiful scenery.   xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Cannon  I used google to look at pics of Glastonbury Abbey and it looks a lovely place to walk was it chilly there and perfectly finished off with Clerks very apt for a walking thread :)   I chose Happybird as even though last year was tough with treatment I went to work and when I walked in the office I always had a smile on my face and my work colleagues/friends were amazed and questioned how I can keep smiling whilst going through this. I didn't now the answer just that I'm a happy bird :)   now I'm a happy bird whose walking back to happiness Debs xxx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi ronstar  Its not mundane what your doing you had my admiration at Run I couldn't run for 3 mins,  I might not be able to run but I sure can bake this was my effort Thursday I would have shared some with you all,  but sorry its all gone now :) Debs xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Leolady56 Lovely picture of the catkins I did my walk today 3.72km drizzly and so cold, I spotted a small white bird skinnier than a pigeon but was whistling away, I stood looking up at the trees trying to see what it was but couldn't see where it went, I must have looked like a crazy woman, I warmed myself up when I got home and made a carrot cake and awarded myself with a generous slice :) I have my oncology appointment next week after the finish if Herceptin does anyone know what to expect, Is it a general chit chat about any side effects, I'm on Tamoxifen alone now.  What is the normal follow up?  Debs xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone I've been in hibernation for 2 days, Its been cold and wet down south and I'm feeling the fatigue a bit, I feel I'm getting more energy then bang it gives you a kick and says Its not over yet. so I've spent more hours in bed and more hours in the arm chair thank god for Winter Olympics and the rugby to keep me amused without me moving. But today is bright and sunny so I will be getting out for a walk at 3pm with my partner it's nicer when he comes out even though I have to say slow down as my feet are 1/2 the size of his :)  Jacmatholmad  What Tamoxibolloxs SE do you have, since I been taking these I've had degenerative disc disease and metarsalagia, hot flashes and days of fatigue, they are truly horrible, yesterday I had 5 hot flashes in the evening clothes were on and off as quick as a stripper  PennyL  I'm sorry you had 3 days in coventry :) nice to see your pics Mirabo  good luck with the move, can't wait to see you pis of pond ronstar lovely picture to encourage us outside, I hope your burn feels better today ShimmeringUnicorn glad your feeling a bit better, hope you not over doing it in preparation for your returning man Here's to a sunny day, lots of walks and lots of pics, have a lovely day everyone Debs xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: ShimmeringUnicorn  wow the returning man must be special if your washing the curtains!! :)  I has vision of you break dancing in the mud with nasal tissue swishing like a morris dancer, yes I have a vivid imagination, all the mentions are thanks to Leolady56 teaching us all how to do it :) Canon  well done church for the soul and a church for the body your set for the day, remember we criticise ourselves more than others do so be kind to yourself, we've all been on a hard journey and I carry some extra pounds but we are here and thats what's really important we have the time to lose the poundage, so be bold and beautiful cos you are here and we will give you the support to get to the gym and to get out in the fresh air. xx now my bum is ready to get out of the arm chair to put on my shoes and get out before the sun disappears Debs xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone ShimmeringUnicorn  Happy birthday to you xx WhatHappened  I sure can bake but I too am no lady :) mrsox   Loving your DM's I was away at the weekend for sister birthday and took my cakes and quiche which were a hit and enjoyed by all. there was 11 off us for dinner, I managed to go out for 2 walks on Saturday, the second walk was with my sister to walk pass the houses we grew in, past the houses our friends lived and past old play ground areas it was nice to reminisce, my sister is a real card and I gave her the presents she requested a jar of decaf coffee, cake and a box of Maltesers :)  It was really nice seeing my great niece whose 2 and my great nephew whose nearly 4, they are great fun, its been a long time since I 've run around a garden like an aeroplane!! I normally come back  with more than I go with thanks to Mum, but this time I came back and Monday came down with a stinky cold, sore throat, sickness, chills and aches and Tuesday and Wednesday spent the days sitting in the armchair my fatigue hit me pretty bad, My partner really doesn't understand the fatigue I think until you have it you don't understand it. It took my 1 hour to get the ump up to get to the toilet yes I was busting by then. not managing to eat much so its just consomme soup and a slice of bread which brings back memories of chemo days,  so no walking for me this week :(  just me, the armchair and my blanky, thank god for the winter Olympics. I've done the reporting it to the doctors as neutrophils are low and suppressed immune system, but hey ho it will go :) Debs xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Canon  I was glad to hear your great nephew is on the mend, fingers crossed that he gets home very soon, I too would see the funny side of a sneeze and something rude,  I also have great nephew and great niece whom are pre-school and they are so precious and such fun  I also never had children....I couldn't face all the years of doing school runs:) Well done for 1.5km I hope to be back out there soon xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi everyone in the walking club I have been getting out most days after work especially when the sun shines, the sunshine is a real boost to get out and walk, which lifts the spirits, I even found myself just sitting on the clifftop enjoying the view not thinking of anything and not time watching which I find I'm quite obsessed with, this journey has taught me alot about myself and made me realise what is important and that is I am important and its good to take time for yourself and take time out to breath the fresh air and enjoy life,  I took these pis on Thursday when the sun was shining, its not me paragliding as Im scared of heights :) Encouragement and hugs to everyone whose getting out walking  Debs xxxx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi WhatHappened I fully understand how we just drive down roads and I am guilty of driving along the clifftop and just going about my busy life. but the BC stopped me in my tracks and made me realise I am important more important than work work work and now I've made adjustments that allow me to walk along the clifftop and breath the fresh air. I even go there when its raining, I always walk with the wind behind me (not that type!!) ha ha  I started walking before Christmas as after BC treatment I had the pleasure of being left with Degenerative disc disease so walking is the best treatment then now its given me inflamed metatarsals in my left foot so I take my time just putting one foot in front of the other and I will get there, I get over taken by older people but thats Ok I've got the time to enjoy my walk, I have a app on my phone that tells me how far I have walked but now I fell guilty if I miss a day I understand the bit about being safe, I won't walk through an area of gorse and shrubs just in case,  I always think better safe than sorry Keep up with your walking, if we can do it in the winter then by the summer we will be fitter and ready to enjoy the sun, I was told to get out to see, to feel, to experience and to enjoy life This picture is for especially for you, I took it yesterday
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi A successful day still got stinky cold but mustered up the umph to get for a 3km gently walk very sunny here but air brisk and fresh, I felt so chuffed to get back walking again, its amazing we can forget what we've gone through, I was talking to my dad last week and was saying I count myself lucky my last cold was 2 years ago, he's reply was well you've had to deal with bigger shit than that last year. I had totally forgotten the BC. but having this stinky cold is I realise I'm not invincible and where as before I could strruggle on now the fatigue rears its ugly head to remind me to be kind to my body and it still needs time to recover, I am now on Citalopram and having success with no hot flushes so in all everything is happy in my life:) Debs xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: moomy Sending you wishes for a swift recovery love and hugs Debsxx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I have been away from numerous months and was thoroughly enjoying my newfound freedom of walking and doing this with my partner of 18 years with my breast cancer year of 2017 under my belt and just carrying on with the Tamoxifen I thought my life was perfect, during that horrendous year my partner lost his father due to lung cancer. But in 2018 we started to see happiness again and thought we were living the dream, I passed my first year mammogram with flying colours and celebrated in an alcohol free way :-) and then the bombshell was dropped on our world, this is worse than having the breast cancer myself my partner was diagnosed with stage II liver cancer and unbelievably a week later this was upgraded to a grade 4 liver cancer and three lymph nodes and lesions on his pancreas so now I find myself in a truly horrendous position of supporting my partner go through palliative chemo, I find it excruciatingly painful from being the patient to now being his carer and helping him through this, I would have gladly have gone through it again for him not to have to deal with this, my walking these days are confined to work and walking the hospital corridors again I cannot work out why I survived breast cancer to watch him suffer with liver cancer or did I survive to help him I'm still undecided on this, my tears are now free-flowing again, I have also decided to stop my Tamoxifen as why would I want to extend my life whilst he's has been shortened, we have been together so long we never felt the need to be married, this has changed our views drastically and we decided we need to get married ASAP, so my life is in total turmoil again due to this horrible horrible cell, I am trying so hard to be strong on the outside but only succeeding in being a mess on the inside, so i am back here and being a not so happy bird :(  Love, success and happiness for everybody on here xxxx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: thank you, your hugs are gratefully received I had my walk down the hospital corridor and my partner escaped from the ward and we came out to a little sunshine with brisk fresh air to breath and another walk trying to find a pay meter that wasn't out of order :)  now hes home I feel whole again  I want to thank you for being here in for my truly lonely times and being a shoulder to cry on and a listening ear,  xxxx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Thank you No one can really understand other than you ladies on here how we go through the poison, cut and burn to survive and each day we get up and get on with our lives and to be there for our loved ones, I can remember the determination of trying to keep things normal for everyone else and having to dig very deep some days just to be normal and now with the tables being turned and I am well and my partner is not is the hardest hardest thing that I have ever had to endure, I feel like I'm a spectator of a train crash and can do nothing to stop it I suppose I'm just feeling useless but in my heart I know I am doing everything I can to help and even becoming quite a nag to him, I am very lucky to have a loving caring family and some very close friends that I made during my own cancer journey what I call my real friends but there is only so much you want to release onto them, I suppose I'm reaching out on here because you really really do understand where I would be coming from and the utter turmoil that I am feeling, no one other than you on here know about me stopping my Tamoxifen, I spoke about it with my partner a few weeks ago and then we moved on with other things and never spoke about it again, I suppose I'm just taking back control of my life making the decision for myself when I stopped taking them I actually felt relief and freedom the weirdest thing of all of this is he is actually walking the same path I did, we have the same specialist and the same oncologist and his treatment is in the same place I had mine I suppose this might give us a slight advantage of actually knowing the people already, and I am already asking 101 questions and keeping them on their toes :-) I am ready to walk through another day of my life and be there for my partner, to be strong and loving for him, but never want him to see the heartbreak in my eyes I shall get up, dust myself down, put my armour on and a smile on my face and show this cancer it cannot beat us big love to everyone xxx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Optimistic I hope that too, its strange I came back here to the walking group I suppose cos it gave me hope in the past and of course you are a great bunch, I feel at the moment I cannot talk to the carers group as I am not ready to confide in names I don't know yet xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Leolady 56 A great thread here's my view of my late afternoon walk along the beach today, today was 3km. the sun was shining, the air was fresh it blows away the cobwebs and invigorates my soul  I am walking my way back to happiness xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi  WhatHappened  Well done, did you fall inline and do a goose step:) I was told by physio to start gently and do what your comfortable doing and you will keep it up, if you go mad then you will cause pain and not want to do it again, A friend said you have to do something 21 times before you enjoy it, It did take me 20 odd times to start enjoying it and then I started to increase the distance. but chocolate and cake I only tried once and loved it :) Debs xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Wow wow wow Leolady56  8 Miles I would put it in capitals too,  hopefully you don't seize up later My best laid plans went out the window today the sun was shining and the plan was work, walk & hospital, had blocked drains so had to wait in for waterboard guy, eventually got to work and had extra job dropped on me then got ready for oncology appointment, left with plenty of time allowing for traffic and blow me no traffic and I was 3/4 hrs early sat waiting onco was running late so I was waiting over 1 hour in total, I've been prescibed Citalopram for hot flushes from the Tamoxifen and now I've been informed to have blood test to check hormone levels and I might have to change to letrozole, now i missed my walk which peed me off but I had a little 15mins walk from the hospital, why do I put myself and what I want to do last on my list, and I'm worried about if I have to take Letrozole which has pain as side effects not good as I already have arthritis pain not sure whether to fight to stay on Tamoxifen or give in to Letrozole but to be honest I really don't want to take either. Any advice from you knowledgeable ladies would be appreciated  Tomorrow I'm definately going for a walk but no way will I be doing 8 miles I'm not that brave yet :) Debs
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi yellowroses & Violetsniff  Thank you for the advice It wont matter to much if my eye brows thin as all through chemo I lost head hair and only lost half of eyebrows and now  my hair came back darker brown and my eye lashes are just as thick as before and being dark haired and fair skinned I have an abundance of hair some more than I would like in the wrong place  :) I am getting ready for weekend away (sisters birthday) and cooking up a feast to take, home made quiche, carrot cake and victoria sponge once cooked I will be getting out for a walk as the sun is shining and it looks beautiful outside mrsox after ready your posts (which always put a smile on my face) including the bacon buttys, kebabs and sausages etc I thought what an atrocious but really nice diet you have but then this morning I spotted the little word veg in your post so you have redeemed yourself big time,  but with all the walking you do you should avoid the big bottom Debs xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Violetsniff  My sister ashamedly used the my sister has BC bomb and got herself out of a parking ticket !! she didn't want our parents to find out about it so I told them :)    I thought it naughty but funny she's so straight laced normally Debs xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: It's not a selfie :)
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Happybird by name and happybird by nature,  xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Eni I had my follow up in Nov 2017 after 20 Rads and it was just a chat about side effects and breast examination to check your breast and the skin,  they told me that this is your new normal breast and signed me off back to oncology. it was a relief to know what is new normal as it settled my mind  Sending you Christmas hugs  Debs x
Posts.Title: After radiitheraphy

Posts.Content: Hi Lesley ramblings, crying and sherry help are brains cope with the BC, the hospitals treat the BC but are slow at helping us treat our minds and soul.  we all have had different ways of coping, I stood in the middle of my lounge and screamed the loudest I could to release my frustration and anger, i did make sure my neighbours were out :)   I cried a lot to but I never said why me I was just so grateful it wasn't my sister going through it.  We all go through stages and have hurdles for us to get over but we do it and today you got over another hurdle and are one more step closer to that winning line so Bravo to you  sending you a big hug and go easy on the Christmas sherry  Debs x
Posts.Title: pathology report

Posts.Content: Hello Machka10 I had a lumpectomy and the hospital would not give the pathology results to me after several requests so I went to see my doctor whom printed it off without a fuss and said if there was any question I needed answering to go back and see him, he pretty incensed that the hospital wouldn't print it off. I also went back for the pathology results from the re-excision from my doctor Sending you hugs Debs xx
Posts.Title: pathology report

Posts.Content: Hi Jo I do hope you haven't got a cold, I fully sympathise with the kicking something I had the feeling I just wanted to punch a wall but  I too was sensible enough not to It's so important to have family & friends around as support, My sister was my greatest support and she doesn't realise how great she is she was there when I needed her most and would drive 2 hrs to be with me whenever I needed her, And when I couldn't handle telling everyone how I was getting on and having the same conversation 8 times really did my head in she was there and became my PA  she is 1 year older than me and she is my hero :)  I was writing Christmas cards this morning with tears rolling down my face, not because I was sad but because of the lots of thank you's I was having to write to all the people that help me get through this year. now I am replacing the  memories of last Christmas with better ones this year  The Doctors will treat our BC but time will heal our minds Debs xx
Posts.Title: pathology report

Posts.Content: Hi Mag65 I had marker clips put on the tumor (they didn't hurt) then chemo then wire locators attached on the same day as op so surgeon could find the lump for the lumpectomy my oncologist advised me against the cold cap so I would advise talking to your oncologist as different chemo effects the hair differently, I had TCHP and lost the lot sending christmas hugs  Debs xx
Posts.Title: Course of action

Posts.Content: Hi Peanut11 I got button up pyjamas from Asda George online make sure you go for soft and stretchy as you don't want anything cutting in or restricting, I had a lumpectomy at about 12 oclock so near the top, I wore a soft sports bra that done up at the front day and night for support and comfort, If I got too hot for Pj's I wore a vest with stringy straps then if arm aches you can get out of it by let it drop downwards I hope this helps Debs xx
Posts.Title: Her2 and ER positive

Posts.Content: Hi Peanut11 I was triple positive Grabe 2b2 46mm lump, I had neoadjuvant TCHP followed by surgery, re-excision, 20 Radiotherapy and year of Herceptin which will be finished this month, 5 years of Tamoxifen With triple positive it might be aggressive but they have more option to treat it with I wish you a safe BC journey Debs xx
Posts.Title: Her2 and ER positive
